I would do the following (assuming this is a fairly young child under 10): Speak to the instructor and mention that the girl is a bit timid and is getting brushed (or bullied) aside. It may be that the child is not comfortable with her skill level in the routine and could really use some one on one. Mention that you would really appreciate it if the instructor would provide a little more guidance. Find out if there is a smaller class where things may move a bit slower and more interaction is available with the instructor. This would allow the child to become more confident in her abilities. content: This does not sound like bullying to me, rather rowdy rambunctios kids who are not displaying manners. Then again, we are talking gymnastics where kids are there to be physical and have fun. It just sounds like she is not a ''go-getter'' at this TIME! Having 6 kids myself at different ages, I can attest they all go through personality/attitude changes. One yr one might be passive, and timid, the next yr, they may be agressive, and not afraid of confrontation. Let them come into their own by themselves, they don't need prodding, or lessons on confronting confrontation, unless they HAVE to. They will get to a point on their own when they learn when to defend themselves. Trust me, i've seen it with my own eyes! "It is the weak who are cruel. Gentleness can only be expected from the strong" -- Leo Roskin

I crawled into a corner over near my car, embarrassed as all heck that I had just got my son booted from the game. Needless to say, I didn't win the "Father of the Year" award that year. Don

Mention that you would really appreciate it if the instructor would provide a little more guidance. Find out if there is a smaller class where things may move a bit slower and more interaction is available with the instructor. This would allow the child to become more confident in her abilities. content: This does not sound like bullying to me, rather rowdy rambunctios kids who are not displaying manners. Then again, we are talking gymnastics where kids are there to be physical and have fun.
